description: ServiceNow has addressed a blind SQL injection vulnerability that was identified in the Now Platform. This vulnerability could enable an unauthenticated user to extract unauthorized information. ServiceNow deployed an update to hosted instances, and ServiceNow provided the update to our partners and self-hosted customers. Further, the vulnerability is addressed in the listed patches and hot fixes.
exploitability_metrics: {'AV': {'value': 'N', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The vulnerability is accessible over the network, allowing unauthenticated users to exploit it remotely.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'AC': {'value': 'L', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The attack complexity is low, as it does not require any special conditions or configurations to exploit the vulnerability.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'PR': {'value': 'N', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'No privileges are required to exploit this vulnerability, as it can be executed by an unauthenticated user.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'UI': {'value': 'N', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'User interaction is not required to exploit this vulnerability, making it easier for attackers.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'S': {'value': 'U', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The scope is unchanged, as the exploitation of this vulnerability does not affect other components beyond the vulnerable system.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}}
exploitation_context: {'contexts': [{'environment': 'Server-side, specifically within the Now Platform', 'explanation': 'The vulnerability is a blind SQL injection, which typically occurs in server-side applications where user input is processed without proper validation or sanitization. Since the vulnerability allows unauthenticated users to exploit the SQL injection, it is crucial that the vulnerable component is accessible over the network without authentication.'}, {'environment': 'Hosted instances of ServiceNow', 'explanation': 'The vulnerability is specifically noted to affect hosted instances of the Now Platform. This means that self-hosted or on-premises configurations may not be vulnerable unless they are running the same version of the Now Platform that contains the flaw.'}], 'general_explanation': 'Exploitation of CVE-2024-8924 is primarily limited to server-side environments where the Now Platform is deployed and accessible to unauthenticated users. The nature of SQL injection attacks requires that the vulnerable application is directly exposed to the internet or an internal network where unauthenticated access is possible.'}
patch: {'release_link': 'https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB1706072', 'last_update': '2024-10-29', 'recommendations': 'Apply the update provided by ServiceNow to address the blind SQL injection vulnerability.'}

description: A stack buffer overflow was addressed through improved input validation. This issue is fixed in Apple TV 1.5.0.152 for Windows, iTunes 12.13.3 for Windows. Parsing a maliciously crafted video file may lead to unexpected system termination.
exploitability_metrics: {'AV': {'value': 'L', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The attack vector is local, which is consistent with the requirement for a local attacker to exploit the vulnerability by parsing a maliciously crafted video file.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'AC': {'value': 'L', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The attack complexity is low, as the description indicates that the vulnerability can be exploited through a straightforward method of parsing a crafted file without any special conditions.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'PR': {'value': 'N', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'No privileges are required to exploit this vulnerability, which aligns with the description stating that a local attacker can exploit it without needing elevated privileges.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'UI': {'value': 'R', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'User interaction is required, as the attacker must convince the user to open the malicious video file, which is consistent with the nature of the vulnerability.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'S': {'value': 'U', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The scope is unchanged, meaning the vulnerability does not propagate to other components or systems, which is appropriate given that it affects only the application processing the video file.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}}
exploitation_context: {'contexts': [{'environment': 'Client-side on Windows 10 and later', 'explanation': 'The vulnerability specifically affects iTunes 12.13.3 and Apple TV 1.5.0.152 for Windows, which are client applications. The exploitation occurs when a user opens a maliciously crafted video file within these applications, leading to a stack buffer overflow and potential system termination.'}], 'general_explanation': 'The exploitation of CVE-2024-44157 is limited to client-side environments running the specified versions of iTunes and Apple TV on Windows 10 and later. The nature of the vulnerability, a stack buffer overflow triggered by input from a video file, requires user interaction to exploit, making it less likely to be exploited in server-side contexts or on unsupported operating systems.'}
patch: {'release_link': 'https://support.apple.com/en-us/121328', 'last_update': '2024-10-11', 'recommendations': 'Apply iTunes 12.13.3 for Windows to address the vulnerability.'}

description: Mirotalk before commit 9de226 was discovered to contain a DOM-based cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability which allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via sending crafted payloads in messages to other users over RTC connections.
exploitability_metrics: {'AV': {'value': 'N', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The attack vector is Network (N), which is appropriate as the vulnerability can be exploited over RTC connections.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'AC': {'value': 'L', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The attack complexity is Low (L), which is appropriate since the attacker can exploit the vulnerability without any special conditions.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'PR': {'value': 'N', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'No privileges are required (N) to exploit this vulnerability, which is accurate as the attacker does not need to be authenticated.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'UI': {'value': 'R', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'User interaction is required (R) because the attacker must send crafted payloads that are executed when the victim interacts with the message.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}, 'S': {'value': 'C', 'assessment': 'Appropriate', 'llm_value': '', 'remarks': 'The scope is unchanged (C), which is appropriate as the vulnerability does not affect other components beyond the vulnerable instance.', 'Justification': 'cve_description'}}
exploitation_context: {'contexts': [{'environment': 'Client-side within a WebRTC video conferencing session', 'explanation': 'The vulnerability is specifically a DOM-based XSS issue that occurs when an attacker sends crafted payloads via chat messages to other users in a WebRTC session. The attacker must be part of the meeting to establish a RTC connection, which allows them to send messages directly to other participants. This means that exploitation is limited to scenarios where the attacker has access to the meeting.'}, {'environment': 'WebRTC-enabled browsers', 'explanation': "The exploitation relies on the browser's ability to execute JavaScript and manipulate the DOM. Therefore, the vulnerability is only exploitable in environments where the MiroTalk application is accessed through a web browser that supports WebRTC, and where the user has not implemented adequate security measures to sanitize input."}], 'general_explanation': "The exploitation of CVE-2024-44731 is limited to scenarios where the attacker is an active participant in a MiroTalk video conference, allowing them to send malicious payloads through chat messages. The nature of the vulnerability, being DOM-based XSS, means that it is contingent upon the execution of JavaScript in the context of the user's browser, making it specific to client-side environments."}
patch: {'release_link': 'https://github.com/miroslavpejic85/mirotalk', 'last_update': '2024-10-11', 'recommendations': 'Apply the latest version of MiroTalk from the provided GitHub repository to address the DOM-based XSS vulnerability.'}

description: In Eclipse Mosquitto up to version 2.0.18a, an attacker can achieve memory leaking, segmentation fault or heap-use-after-free by sending specific sequences of "CONNECT", "DISCONNECT", "SUBSCRIBE", "UNSUBSCRIBE" and "PUBLISH" packets.
exploitation_context: {'contexts': [{'environment': 'Server-side deployment of Eclipse Mosquitto broker', 'explanation': 'The vulnerability is primarily exploitable in a server-side context where the Mosquitto broker is running. Attackers can send crafted MQTT packets (CONNECT, DISCONNECT, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE, PUBLISH) to the broker, leading to memory leaks or segmentation faults.'}, {'environment': 'Specific versions of Eclipse Mosquitto (up to 2.0.18a)', 'explanation': 'The vulnerability is limited to specific versions of the Mosquitto broker. Versions beyond 2.0.18a have been patched, making exploitation impossible in those versions.'}, {'environment': 'MQTT protocol usage', 'explanation': 'The exploitation relies on the MQTT protocol, which is used for message queuing. If the broker is not configured to accept MQTT connections or if it is not used in an MQTT context, the vulnerability cannot be exploited.'}], 'general_explanation': 'The exploitation of CVE-2024-8376 is limited to specific server-side environments where the vulnerable version of the Eclipse Mosquitto broker is deployed and actively processing MQTT packets. The nature of the vulnerability requires the broker to be exposed to potentially malicious MQTT traffic.'}
patch: {'release_link': 'https://github.com/eclipse/mosquitto/releases/tag/v2.0.19', 'last_update': '2024-10-02', 'recommendations': 'Upgrade to version 2.0.19 to address the vulnerability.'}
